text: Mahonia decipiens is a species of shrub in the Berberidaceae described as a species in 1913.Sargent, Charles Sprague. 1913. Plantae Wilsonianae. An Enumeration of the Woody Plants Collected in Western China for the Arnold Arboretum of Harvard University 1: 379 It is endemic to Hubei Province in China.Flora of China Vol. 19 Page 776 鄂西十大功劳 e xi shi da gong lao Mahonia decipiens C. K. Schneider in Sargent The species is listed as vulnerable.China Plant Specialist Group 2004. Mahonia decipiens. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 22 August 2007. ==References== decipiens Category:Flora of Hubei Category:Endemic flora of China Category:Vulnerable plants Category:Plants described in 1913 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Mahonia decipiens
